overall_building_description: The fall arrest system design incorporates a robust assembly of structural components, ensuring both safety and functionality. The primary load-bearing elements include the NIKO 26.000 track, which is supported by C6x8.2 back-to-back beams. These beams are fastened using 5/8-inch diameter A325 bolts, which are complemented by 3-inch by 3/8-inch thick washers, providing a secure and stable connection. The vertical supports are fabricated from 30-inch long, 3-inch by 3/4-inch thick flat bars, which are machined to 3/8-inch thickness to accommodate the NIKO 26.803 support brackets. The system's lateral stability is enhanced by L2x2x1/4 sway braces, which are secured with 1/2-inch diameter A325 bolts. The connection details are meticulously designed to ensure proper load transfer and minimize deflection. The C6x8.2 beams are coped to fit around existing structures, with a minimum 1/2-inch radius on the cope and a maximum 12-inch limit on the existing pipe side. This precise coping ensures that the system integrates seamlessly with the existing infrastructure, avoiding any interference with pipes or other obstructions. The HSS1.5x1.5x1/4 sections, 24 inches long, are installed on both sides of the beams, providing additional reinforcement and stability. The assembly sequence is critical, with the installation of the HSS sections preceding the fastening of the sway braces and support brackets. The fabrication details specify the use of 4 5/16-inch by 3/8-inch thick plates, which are notched into the flat bar supports, ensuring a snug fit and optimal load distribution. The system's design adheres to stringent code compliance requirements, with all components and connections engineered to withstand the specified loads and environmental conditions. The use of A325 bolts and the specified washer sizes ensure that the connections meet the necessary shear and tensile strength criteria. The fall arrest track system is designed for ease of installation, with clear fabrication and assembly instructions provided in the detailed drawings. The system's modular design allows for flexibility in installation, accommodating various building layouts and configurations. The detailed section views and fabrication details provide comprehensive guidance on the installation process, ensuring that all components are correctly aligned and securely fastened. The system's design also considers potential site-specific requirements, such as access constraints and environmental factors, ensuring that the installation can be completed efficiently and safely. Overall, the fall arrest system is a meticulously engineered solution, combining structural integrity with practical functionality to provide a reliable safety system for industrial applications.
